abstract.text: The shared recorder object that provides the ability to record audio and video of your app.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Apps on a user’s device can share the recording function, with each app having its own instance of
. Your app can record the audio and video inside of the app, along with user commentary through the microphone. You get a reference to the recorder through the

function and use it to implement start-and-stop recording functionality. You can present a user interface (view controller) where a user can trim and preview recordings, and share them with other users. Only one app at a time can use the recorder on the user’s device. Your app can’t record video from

abstract.text: An object that provides the interface to control the player’s transport behavior.
Record or stream video from the screen, and audio from the app and microphone.
The position of the camera being accessed.
An object that displays a user interface where users preview and edit a screen recording that you create with ReplayKit.
The type of media clip sample being buffered.
The shared recorder object that provides the ability to record audio and video of your app.
The camera position to use.
A view containing the contents of the front-facing camera.
The delegate for the screen recorder.
Discards the current recording.
Exports a clip recording to a file.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the screen recorder is available for recording.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the camera is currently enabled.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the microphone is currently enabled.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the app is currently recording.
Returns an app’s instance of the shared screen recorder.
Starts screen and audio capture.
Starts buffering a clip recording.
Starts recording the app display.
Starts recording the app’s audio and video.
Stops screen capture
Stops buffering a clip recording.
Stops the current recording.
Stops the current recording and writes the movie to the specified output URL.
The protocol you implement to receive notifications from the screen recorder.
Share screen recordings, or broadcast live audio and video of your app, by adding ReplayKit to your macOS apps and games.

doc://com.apple.replaykit/documentation/.title: Recording and Streaming Your macOS App

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
